docs.snippet: A 20-year-old Mormon missionary is dead after a fatal fall in Micronesia....

headline.print_headline: Russia Vows to Veto U.S. Draft at U.N. Declaring Crimea Vote Illegal
headline.main: Russia Vows to Veto U.S. Draft at U.N. Declaring Crimea Vote Illegal

docs.snippet: The United States circulated a draft resolution to the U.N. Security Council on Thursday that would declare Sunday's planned referendum on independence for Ukraine's Crimea region illegal, but Russia has vowed to veto it, council diplomats said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States circulated a draft resolution to the U.N. Security Council on Thursday that would declare Sunday's planned referendum on independence for Ukraine's Crimea region illegal, but Russia has vowed to veto it, council diplomats said.

headline.print_headline: Lil Boosie's Probation Includes Community Service
headline.main: Lil Boosie's Probation Includes Community Service

docs.snippet: Rapper Torence "Lil Boosie" Hatch was ordered Thursday to perform 100 hours of community service in New Orleans as part of his four-year probation term stemming from a 2009 guilty plea to a marijuana possession charge....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rapper Torence "Lil Boosie" Hatch was ordered Thursday to perform 100 hours of community service in New Orleans as part of his four-year probation term stemming from a 2009 guilty plea to a marijuana possession charge.

headline.print_headline: Jamaican Rapper, 3 Others Convicted of Murder
headline.main: Jamaican Rapper, 3 Others Convicted of Murder

docs.snippet: Popular dancehall reggae star Vybz Kartel and three co-defendants were convicted of murder Thursday in a high-profile trial under heavy security in this Caribbean country's supreme court....
docs.lead_paragraph: Popular dancehall reggae star Vybz Kartel and three co-defendants were convicted of murder Thursday in a high-profile trial under heavy security in this Caribbean country's supreme court.

headline.print_headline: Florida Supreme Court Voids Caps on Medical Malpractice Lawsuits
headline.main: Florida Supreme Court Voids Caps on Medical Malpractice Lawsuits

docs.snippet: The Florida Supreme Court on Thursday struck down a state law that placed a $1 million limit on the amount of money people can be awarded in wrongful death cases caused by medical malpractice....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Florida Supreme Court on Thursday struck down a state law that placed a $1 million limit on the amount of money people can be awarded in wrongful death cases caused by medical malpractice.

headline.print_headline: Ukraine Prompts Fresh U.S. Look at Use of Russian Rocket Engines
headline.main: Ukraine Prompts Fresh U.S. Look at Use of Russian Rocket Engines

docs.snippet: The Pentagon is going to take a fresh look at U.S. reliance on Russian-built engines to power American rockets that launch large U.S. government satellites into orbit, in light of the Ukraine crisis, Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel told Congress on ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Pentagon is going to take a fresh look at U.S. reliance on Russian-built engines to power American rockets that launch large U.S. government satellites into orbit, in light of the Ukraine crisis, Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel told Congress on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Contractor Pleads Guilty to Giving Chinese Woman Secrets
headline.main: U.S. Contractor Pleads Guilty to Giving Chinese Woman Secrets

docs.snippet: A U.S. defense contractor in Hawaii pleaded guilty on Thursday to charges he passed national defense secrets, including classified information on joint training and planning exercises with South Korea, to a Chinese woman with whom he was romantica...
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. defense contractor in Hawaii pleaded guilty on Thursday to charges he passed national defense secrets, including classified information on joint training and planning exercises with South Korea, to a Chinese woman with whom he was romantically involved, prosecutors said.

headline.print_headline: Bin Laden Relative Admitted Al Qaeda Link, FBI Agent Says
headline.main: Bin Laden Relative Admitted Al Qaeda Link, FBI Agent Says

docs.snippet: Suleiman Abu Ghaith admitted that months before al Qaeda's 2001 hijacked jet attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon, he promised Osama bin Laden he would be a spokesman for the group, an FBI agent testified on Thursday in a U.S. court....
docs.lead_paragraph: Suleiman Abu Ghaith admitted that months before al Qaeda's 2001 hijacked jet attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon, he promised Osama bin Laden he would be a spokesman for the group, an FBI agent testified on Thursday in a U.S. court.

headline.main: In Snub to Loeb, Sotheby's Board Nominates 2 Independent Directors

docs.snippet: Sotheby’s nominated Jessica Bibliowicz, a financial industry veteran, and Kevin C. Conroy, a senior executive at Univision, saying that the nominees of the hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb added “no relevant expertise” that its board didn’t ...
docs.abstract: Sotheby’s nominated Jessica Bibliowicz, a financial industry veteran, and Kevin C. Conroy, a senior executive at Univision, saying that the nominees of the hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb added “no relevant expertise” that its board didn’t already have.
